1.09 Generators: Evaluations
You cannot only pick from value sets, but you can also evaluate value sets themselves. At this point it behaves more like Clozes.
The name of the meta element is "$evaluate(count, valueset, uniqueness_constraint)". "evaluate" can be shortenend to "eval", or just "e". Both arguments, "count", and "uniqueness_constraint", are optional.
Example: What's the capital of Germany: [[$c1:Berlin:starts with B::$eval(c1:1)]]
As you can see, it now shows the hint. Now try reversing...
And now, it shows the answer: [[$eval(c1:0)]]!
So in short, the evaluations are like reversed picks: instead of generating the element where the pick element used to be, it generates the element where the value set used to be!
And just like picks, evaluations also supports wildcards, counts, and uniqueness constraints:
[[$gr|alpha|beta|gamma|delta::$eval(4, gr:*, uc)]]
